Foundation is not fully visible.

Typical cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.text: Crawlspace is partially accessible, however, viewing is limited in some areas; only partially entered/partially inspected.

wood framing

Metal supports.

comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the landscaping:
Maintenance needed
Trees are touching/overhanging the roof.  Damage is possible. Trim plants and trees away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

Deterioration noted to deck surface
Repairs recommended

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text:
Front Porch and Rear Patio:
Same as structure, open design

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Detached sheds are typically not included as part of a home inspection however a courtesy inspection was performed and the shed appears serviceable.
Measures 6’X8’

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Normal signs of weathering and aging noted. Regular maintenance recommended. 
The following concerns were noted at the fence:
Loose/rotted posts
Rusting noted
Non-professional repairs noted
Consult with a qualified professional and make repairs/corrections/improvements as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Deterioration noted to deck surface
Repairs recommended
Low elevation of deck prevents any viewing under the deck structure.

comments.name: ROOF COVERING STATUS
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable with signs of weathering and aging. Regular maintenance and inspections are advised. Maintenance will help ensure the weather tightness of the building and should be performed on a regular basis.
Roof mounted equipment noted.  As fasteners inserted through the roof surface increase the possibility for leakage this area must be regularly maintained and inspected.
The following concerns were noted at the roof:
Damaged shingles noted at the             Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and repair/replace.
Granule loss and cupping of shingles noted. These are usually the result of weathering and aging of roof covering. Repair as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted at the flashings:
No storm collar installed in metal vents. 
Recommend installing and sealing at the top of the storm collars on the Heater/Water heater vent pipes.

comments.name: TYPE & CONDITION
comments.text: None.  Consider installing gutters and downspouts to help with site drainage

comments.name: MATERIAL AND SIZE
comments.text: Main line is 3/4 inch diameter Galvanized

comments.name: LOCATION
comments.text: Main water shut off valve is located in the crawlspace

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable, valve not tested, water pressure appears adequate.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the water supply lines:
Significant corrosion is noted
Copper/Galvanized piping contact is noted.  Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Plumbing vents appear serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the waste lines:
ABS to PVC contact noted. Glue may not properly adhere and openings may result.
Non-professional repairs noted
Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair or replace.

comments.name: OPERATION
comments.text:
Sample operated appeared serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the hose faucets:
No anti-siphon devices noted at exterior hose bibs

comments.name: METER/TANK LOCATION-CONDITION
comments.text:
Meter located at the right side of the building
System appears serviceable

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
Pressure relief valve noted not tested
A water shutoff valve is installed
Flue vent appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the water heater:
Temperature is in excess of 120 degrees. 
Recommend lowering to safe levels. 
Rust flakes/corrosion noted
Pressure relief valve drain line ends prematurely.  We recommend this drain line be extended to a safe location/pointing toward and terminating within 6'' of the ground.

comments.name: SERVICE CAPACITY
comments.text: 60 Amps- Generally considered insufficient for today's power needs. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed electrician and upgrade as needed

comments.name: MAIN PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible
Grounding system is present

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible switches and receptacles were tested.  As a whole receptacles and switches throughout the building are in serviceable condition.
The following concerns were noted with the switches and receptacles:
Loose receptacles noted. Recommend securing.
Damaged receptacles noted. Recommend replacing.
Two prong ungrounded type receptacles were noted
Non-professional repairs noted
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed electrician and repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible lights were tested.  As a whole lighting throughout the building is in serviceable condition.
The following concerns were noted with the lights:
The lights are not operational in some areas. It could be due to bad bulbs or bad fixtures.  Recommend verifying proper operation of lights before closing.

Sink appears serviceable

Drain appear serviceable
Counters/cabinets appear serviceable.

The toilet does not flush properly and needs repair.

 The shower head is leaking

Spray wand is inoperable.
Spray wand is damaged.
Restricted access due to personal belongings. Unable to fully inspect. Perform a thorough inspection prior to closing after personal items have been removed.

240V Service-operational and the electrical outlet is grounded

comments.name: GENERAL CONDITION OF CONDENSER - COMPRESSOR
comments.text: Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

comments.name: EVAPORATOR AGE
comments.text: Information tag is not visible/not readable. Unable to determine age

comments.name: INTERIOR AIR TEMPERATURE DROP
comments.text:
Less than 12 degrees F- Cooling not adequate
Cooling unit appears inoperable. 
Recommend evaluation by a licensed HVAC technician and repair or replace.

comments.name: EVAPORATOR COIL CONDITION
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at the interior AC system:
Unit is not operating properly.  Recommend servicing the system, checking the refrigerant levels, and making any recommended repairs.Replace the unit as needed.

comments.name: HEATING FUEL TYPE
comments.text: Natural Gas. (The heat exchanger portion of a gas or oil fired heater is difficult to access without disassembly and cannot be adequately checked during a visual inspection.  We recommend a service contract be placed on the unit and a heating contractor called to verify the condition of the heat exchanger prior to settlement date.)

comments.name: HEATING SYSTEM YEAR OF MANUFACTURE
comments.text: Unable to determine however unit appears to be original to building. Verify age with seller.

comments.name: HEATING SYSTEM CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears operational
Heating system appears to be over 20 years old.  Units of this advanced age are more susceptible to heat exchanger problems.  It is recommended that any unit over 20 years of age be evaluated by a qualified licensed HVAC professional prior to closing to clean/service the blower motor, vent system, burner chamber and make necessary repairs/replacements as needed.

comments.name: AIR FILTERS
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at air filter:
Missing filter

comments.name: HEATING SYSTEM GENERAL SUGGESTIONS
comments.text: Suggest cleaning/servicing blower motor pilot light vent system and burners

comments.name: BUILDING OCCUPIED?
comments.text: Yes  (It is assumed that some areas are concealed by furniture or other personal property. Inspectors are not allowed to move personal property during their inspection. It is highly recommended that the purchaser perform a thorough inspection during their final walk through.)

comments.name: PEOPLE PRESENT
comments.text: Homeowner building is in severe disrepair and has extensive damage and pet damage throughout the inside and around the exterior. Unfinished and non-professional repairs are noted throughout the building and around the exterior. building will need a considerable amount of work and repairs to bring it up to typical construction and living standards in the area. We recommend consulting with several contractors and obtaining at least three bids prior to closing on the property. We are confident that there will be additional damage and problems discovered while the property is being reconstructed that we are unable to see at this time and stress that you consider these unforeseen problems when evaluating bids.

comments.name: ADDITIONAL COMMENTS
comments.text: building is in severe disrepair and has extensive damage and pet damage throughout the inside and around the exterior. Unfinished and non-professional repairs are noted throughout the building and around the exterior. building will need a considerable amount of work and repairs to bring it up to typical construction and living standards in the area. We recommend consulting with several contractors and obtaining at least three bids prior to closing on the property. We are confident that there will be additional damage and problems discovered while the property is being reconstructed that we are unable to see at this time and stress that you consider these unforeseen problems when evaluating bids.
